Sequence Information.Peptide Name: XLAsp-P1 (Asp-rich; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals, UCLL1a)
Sequence Information.Source: skin, African clawed frog,Xenopus laevis, Africa

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide most resembles (66.7% similarity)sheep Anionic peptide SAAP.Activity: Active against Gram+ bacteria S. aureus ATC29213 (MIC 10 ug/ml), S. sciuri (MIC 50 ug/ml), R. nasimurium (MIC 10 ug/ml), A. viridans (MIC 20 ug/ml), Gram- bacteria E. coli ATC25922 or O111 (MIC 50 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae (MIC 50 ug/ml), and A. bacillus (MIC 50 uM). Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Li S, Hao L, Bao W, Zhang P, Su D, Cheng Y, Nie L, Wang G, Hou F, Yang Y.2016
Literature Information.Title: A novel short anionic antibacterial peptide isolated from the skin of Xenopus laevis with broad antibacterial activity and inhibitory activity against breast cancer cell.
